NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Bundle 0..*BundleContains a collection of resources
type 1..1codedocument | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection
Required Pattern: collection
timestamp S0..1instantWhen the bundle was assembled
Slices for entry S1..*BackboneElementEntry in the bundle - will have a resource or information
Slice: Unordered, Open by profile:resource
entry:All Slices Content/Rules for all slices
resource S1..1ResourceA resource in the bundle
entry:cancerPatient S1..1BackboneElementCancer Patient
resource 0..1CancerPatientInformation about an individual or animal receiving health care services
entry:cancerDiseaseStatus S0..*BackboneElementCancer Disease Status
resource 0..1CancerDiseaseStatusMeasurements and simple assertions
entry:cancerRelatedMedicationAdministration S0..*BackboneElementCancer-Related Medication Administration
resource 0..1CancerRelatedMedicationAdministrationAdministration of medication to a patient
entry:cancerRelatedMedicationRequest S0..*BackboneElementCancer-Related Medication Request
resource 0..1CancerRelatedMedicationRequestOrdering of medication for patient or group
entry:cancerRelatedSurgicalProcedure S0..*BackboneElementCancer-Related Surgical Procedure
resource 0..1CancerRelatedSurgicalProcedureAn action that is being or was performed on a patient
entry:cancerStageAssessment S0..*BackboneElementCancer Stage Group Group
resource 0..1CancerStageGroupMeasurements and simple assertions
entry:comorbidities S0..*BackboneElementCancer-Related Comorbidities
resource 0..1ComorbiditiesMeasurements and simple assertions
entry:diagnosticImplications S0..*BackboneElementGenomic Diagnostic Implications
resource 0..1DiagnosticImplicationDiagnostic Implication
entry:ecogPerformanceStatus S0..*BackboneElementECOG Performance Status
resource 0..1ECOGPerformanceStatusMeasurements and simple assertions
entry:genomicRegionStudied S0..*BackboneElementGenomic Region Studied
resource 0..1GenomicRegionStudiedRegion Studied
entry:genomicsReport S0..*BackboneElementGenomics Report
resource 0..1GenomicsReportA Diagnostic report - a combination of request information, atomic results, images, interpretation, as well as formatted reports
entry:humanSpecimen S0..*BackboneElementHuman Specimen
resource 0..1HumanSpecimenSample for analysis
entry:genomicVariant S0..*BackboneElementGenomic Variant
resource 0..1GenomicVariantVariant
entry:karnofskyPerformanceStatus S0..*BackboneElementKarnofsky Performance Status
resource 0..1KarnofskyPerformanceStatusMeasurements and simple assertions
entry:radiotherapyCourseSummary S0..*BackboneElementRadiation Summary
resource 0..1RadiotherapyCourseSummaryAn action that is being or was performed on a patient
entry:radiotherapyVolume S0..*BackboneElementRadiotherapy Volume
resource 0..1RadiotherapyVolumeSpecific and identified anatomical structure
entry:primaryCancerCondition S0..*BackboneElementPrimary Cancer Condition
resource 0..1PrimaryCancerConditionDetailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses
entry:secondaryCancerCondition S0..*BackboneElementSecondary Cancer Condition
resource 0..1SecondaryCancerConditionDetailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses
entry:tumor S0..*BackboneElementTumor
resource 0..1TumorSpecific and identified anatomical structure
entry:tumorMarkerTest S0..*BackboneElementTumor Marker Tests
resource 0..1TumorMarkerTestMeasurements and simple assertions
entry:tumorSize S0..*BackboneElementTumor Size Measurements
resource 0..1TumorSizeMeasurements and simple assertions
entry:vitalSigns S0..*BackboneElementVital Signs
resource 0..1USCoreVitalSignsProfileUS Core Vital Signs Profile

Documentation for this format

name: MCODEPatientBundle
title: mCODE Patient Bundle Profile
description: A collection of data for an mCODE cancer patient.

element.definition: A container for a collection of resources.

constraint.human: total only when a search or history
entry.search only when a search
entry.request mandatory for batch/transaction/history, otherwise prohibited
entry.response mandatory for batch-response/transaction-response/history, otherwise prohibited
FullUrl must be unique in a bundle, or else entries with the same fullUrl must have different meta.versionId (except in history bundles)
A document must have an identifier with a system and a value
A document must have a date
A document must have a Composition as the first resource
A message must have a MessageHeader as the first resource

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A human language.

element.definition: A persistent identifier for the bundle that won't change as a bundle is copied from server to server.
element.comment: Persistent identity generally only matters for batches of type Document, Message, and Collection. It would not normally be populated for search and history results and servers ignore Bundle.identifier when processing batches and transactions. For Documents  the .identifier SHALL be populated such that the .identifier is globally unique.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection
element.definition: Indicates the purpose of this bundle - how it is intended to be used.
element.comment: It's possible to use a bundle for other purposes (e.g. a document can be accepted as a transaction). This is primarily defined so that there can be specific rules for some of the bundle types.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

element.definition: The date/time that the bundle was assembled - i.e. when the resources were placed in the bundle.
element.comment:
For many bundles, the timestamp is equal to .meta.lastUpdated, because they are not stored (e.g. search results). When a bundle is placed in a persistent store, .meta.lastUpdated will be usually be changed by the server. When the bundle is a message, a middleware agent altering the message (even if not stored) SHOULD update .meta.lastUpdated. .timestamp is used to track the original time of the Bundle, and SHOULD be populated.  

Usage:

* document : the date the document was created. Note: the composition may predate the document, or be associated with multiple documents. The date of the composition - the authoring time - may be earlier than the document assembly time
* message : the date that the content of the message was assembled. This date is not changed by middleware engines unless they add additional data that changes the meaning of the time of the message
* history : the date that the history was assembled. This time would be used as the _since time to ask for subsequent updates
* searchset : the time that the search set was assembled. Note that different pages MAY have different timestamps but need not. Having different timestamps does not imply that subsequent pages will represent or include changes made since the initial query
* transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | collection : no particular assigned meaning

The timestamp value should be greater than the lastUpdated and other timestamps in the resources in the bundle, and it should be equal or earlier than the .meta.lastUpdated on the Bundle itself.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: If search, the total number of matches
element.definition: If a set of search matches, this is the total number of entries of type 'match' across all pages in the search.  It does not include search.mode = 'include' or 'outcome' entries and it does not provide a count of the number of entries in the Bundle.
element.comment: Only used if the bundle is a search result set. The total does not include resources such as OperationOutcome and included resources, only the total number of matching resources.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A series of links that provide context to this bundle.
element.comment:
Both Bundle.link and Bundle.entry.link are defined to support providing additional context when Bundles are used (e.g. [HATEOAS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HATEOAS)). 

Bundle.entry.link corresponds to links found in the HTTP header if the resource in the entry was [read](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#read) directly.

This specification defines some specific uses of Bundle.link for [searching](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#conformance) and [paging](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#paging), but no specific uses for Bundle.entry.link, and no defined function in a transaction - the meaning is implementation specific.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. element.orderMeaning: For bundles of type 'document' and 'message', the first resource is special (must be Composition or MessageHeader respectively). For all bundles, the meaning of the order of entries depends on the bundle type

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

element.definition: Why this entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.
element.comment: There is only one mode. In some corner cases, a resource may be included because it is both a match and an include. In these circumstances, 'match' takes precedence.

element.definition: When searching, the server's search ranking score for the entry.
element.comment:
Servers are not required to return a ranking score. 1 is most relevant, and 0 is least relevant. Often, search results are sorted by score, but the client may specify a different sort order.

See [Patient Match](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/patient-operation-match.html) for the EMPI search which relates to this element.

element.definition: In a transaction or batch, this is the HTTP action to be executed for this entry. In a history bundle, this indicates the HTTP action that occurred.

element.definition: The URL for this entry, relative to the root (the address to which the request is posted).
element.comment: E.g. for a Patient Create, the method would be "POST" and the URL would be "Patient". For a Patient Update, the method would be PUT and the URL would be "Patient/[id]".

element.short: OperationOutcome with hints and warnings (for batch/transaction)
element.definition: An OperationOutcome containing hints and warnings produced as part of processing this entry in a batch or transaction.
element.comment:
For a POST/PUT operation, this is the equivalent outcome that would be returned for prefer = operationoutcome - except that the resource is always returned whether or not the outcome is returned.

This outcome is not used for error responses in batch/transaction, only for hints and warnings. In a batch operation, the error will be in Bundle.entry.response, and for transaction, there will be a single OperationOutcome instead of a bundle in the case of an error.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

element.short: Information about an individual or animal receiving health care services

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
Either Patient.name.given and/or Patient.name.family SHALL be present or a Data Absent Reason Extension SHALL be present.

element.definition: An OperationOutcome containing hints and warnings produced as part of processing this entry in a batch or transaction.
element.comment:
For a POST/PUT operation, this is the equivalent outcome that would be returned for prefer = operationoutcome - except that the resource is always returned whether or not the outcome is returned.

This outcome is not used for error responses in batch/transaction, only for hints and warnings. In a batch operation, the error will be in Bundle.entry.response, and for transaction, there will be a single OperationOutcome instead of a bundle in the case of an error.

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Administration of medication to a patient
element.definition: Describes the event of a patient consuming or otherwise being administered a medication.  This may be as simple as swallowing a tablet or it may be a long running infusion.  Related resources tie this event to the authorizing prescription, and the specific encounter between patient and health care practitioner.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.definition: When searching, the server's search ranking score for the entry.

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
Performed SHALL be present if the status is 'completed' or 'in-progress'
One of reasonCode or reasonReference SHALL be present

However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

element.comment: Used for simple observations such as device measurements, laboratory atomic results, vital signs, height, weight, smoking status, comments, etc.  Other resources are used to provide context for observations such as laboratory reports, etc.

constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.short: A Diagnostic report - a combination of request information, atomic results, images, interpretation, as well as formatted reports
element.definition: The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.
element.comment: This is intended to capture a single report and is not suitable for use in displaying summary information that covers multiple reports.  For example, this resource has not been designed for laboratory cumulative reporting formats nor detailed structured reports for sequencing.

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.comment:

This outcome is not used for error responses in batch/transaction, only for hints and warnings. In a batch operation, the error will be in Bundle.entry.response, and for transaction, there will be a single OperationOutcome instead of a bundle in the case of an error.

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

For a POST/PUT operation, this is the equivalent outcome that would be returned for prefer = operationoutcome - except that the resource is always returned whether or not the outcome is returned.

This outcome is not used for error responses in batch/transaction, only for hints and warnings. In a batch operation, the error will be in Bundle.entry.response, and for transaction, there will be a single OperationOutcome instead of a bundle in the case of an error.

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

element.definition: Measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other subject.
element.comment: Used for simple observations such as device measurements, laboratory atomic results, vital signs, height, weight, smoking status, comments, etc.  Other resources are used to provide context for observations such as laboratory reports, etc.

constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.

fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

mapping.map: Archetype ID   openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.anatomical_location.v1      Concept name   Anatomical Location      Concept description   Record details about an anatomical location.      Keywords   location, site, anatomical      Copyright    openEHR Foundation      Purpose   To record details about anatomical location.      Misuse   Not for specifiying unilateral/bilateral occurrence - this is related to an evaluation which perhaps includes multiple locations.      Author   Author name: Heather Leslie Organization: Ocean Informatics Email: heather.leslie@oceaninformatics.com Date of Origination: 2008-11-10       Translator   Norwegian Bokml: Lars Bitsch-Larsen, Haukeland University Hospital of Bergen, Norway, MD, DEAA, MBA, spec in anesthesia, spec in tropical medicine. element.short: OperationOutcome with hints and warnings (for batch/transaction)
element.definition: An OperationOutcome containing hints and warnings produced as part of processing this entry in a batch or transaction.
element.comment:
For a POST/PUT operation, this is the equivalent outcome that would be returned for prefer = operationoutcome - except that the resource is always returned whether or not the outcome is returned.

This outcome is not used for error responses in batch/transaction, only for hints and warnings. In a batch operation, the error will be in Bundle.entry.response, and for transaction, there will be a single OperationOutcome instead of a bundle in the case of an error.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

element.short: Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses

extension.valueMarkdown: Most systems will expect a clinicalStatus to be valued for problem-list-items that are managed over time, but might not need a clinicalStatus for point in time encounter-diagnosis.

constraint.human: Condition.clinicalStatus SHALL be present if verificationStatus is not entered-in-error and category is problem-list-item
If condition is abated, then clinicalStatus must be either inactive, resolved, or remission
constraint.expression: abatement.empty() or clinicalStatus.coding.where(system='http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-clinical' and (code='resolved' or code='remission' or code='inactive')).exists()

constraint.human: Condition.clinicalStatus SHALL NOT be present if verification Status is entered-in-error
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

element.short: OperationOutcome with hints and warnings (for batch/transaction)
element.definition: An OperationOutcome containing hints and warnings produced as part of processing this entry in a batch or transaction.
element.comment:
For a POST/PUT operation, this is the equivalent outcome that would be returned for prefer = operationoutcome - except that the resource is always returned whether or not the outcome is returned.

This outcome is not used for error responses in batch/transaction, only for hints and warnings. In a batch operation, the error will be in Bundle.entry.response, and for transaction, there will be a single OperationOutcome instead of a bundle in the case of an error.

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
dataAbsentReason SHALL only be present if Observation.value[x] is not present
If Observation.code is the same as an Observation.component.code then the value element associated with the code SHALL NOT be present
If there is no component or hasMember element then either a value[x] or a data absent reason must be present

element.definition: Why this entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.
element.comment: There is only one mode. In some corner cases, a resource may be included because it is both a match and an include. In these circumstances, 'match' takes precedence.

binding.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

element.definition: When searching, the server's search ranking score for the entry.
element.comment:
Servers are not required to return a ranking score. 1 is most relevant, and 0 is least relevant. Often, search results are sorted by score, but the client may specify a different sort order.

See [Patient Match](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/patient-operation-match.html) for the EMPI search which relates to this element.

Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
dataAbsentReason SHALL only be present if Observation.value[x] is not present
If Observation.code is the same as an Observation.component.code then the value element associated with the code SHALL NOT be present
If there is no component or hasMember element then either a value[x] or a data absent reason must be present
Either `focus` OR `specimen` MUST be populated

element.definition: When searching, the server's search ranking score for the entry.

Servers are not required to return a ranking score. 1 is most relevant, and 0 is least relevant. Often, search results are sorted by score, but the client may specify a different sort order.

See [Patient Match](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/patient-operation-match.html) for the EMPI search which relates to this element.

element.short: OperationOutcome with hints and warnings (for batch/transaction)
element.definition: An OperationOutcome containing hints and warnings produced as part of processing this entry in a batch or transaction.
element.comment:
For a POST/PUT operation, this is the equivalent outcome that would be returned for prefer = operationoutcome - except that the resource is always returned whether or not the outcome is returned.

This outcome is not used for error responses in batch/transaction, only for hints and warnings. In a batch operation, the error will be in Bundle.entry.response, and for transaction, there will be a single OperationOutcome instead of a bundle in the case of an error.

element.definition: A series of links that provide context to this entry.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: URI for resource (Absolute URL server address or URI for UUID/OID)
element.definition:
The Absolute URL for the resource.  The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except that: 
* fullUrl can be empty on a POST (although it does not need to when specifying a temporary id for reference in the bundle)
* Results from operations might involve resources that are not identified.
element.comment:
fullUrl might not be [unique in the context of a resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html), the fullURL might be a URN or an absolute URL that does not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id). However, but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#regex), then the 'id' portion of the fullUrl SHALL end with the Resource.id.

Note that the fullUrl is not the same as the canonical URL - it's an absolute url for an endpoint serving the resource (these will happen to have the same value on the canonical server for the resource with the canonical URL).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

This outcome is not used for error responses in batch/transaction, only for hints and warnings. In a batch operation, the error will be in Bundle.entry.response, and for transaction, there will be a single OperationOutcome instead of a bundle in the case of an error.

element.definition: Digital Signature - base64 encoded. XML-DSig or a JWT.
element.comment: The signature could be created by the "author" of the bundle or by the originating device.   Requirements around inclusion of a signature, verification of signatures and treatment of signed/non-signed bundles is implementation-environment specific.
element.requirements: A Signature holds an electronic representation of a signature and its supporting context in a FHIR accessible form. The signature may either be a cryptographic type (XML DigSig or a JWS), which is able to provide non-repudiation proof, or it may be a graphical image that represents a signature or a signature process. This element allows capturing signatures on documents, messages, transactions or even search responses, to support content-authentication, non-repudiation or other business cases. This is primarily relevant where the bundle may travel through multiple hops or via other mechanisms where HTTPS non-repudiation is insufficient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The Cancer Patient whose data is included in the bundle.
Observations resource representing Cancer Disease Status. Include past assessments if available.
MedicationAdministration resource representing medication administrations.
MedicationRequest resources representing cancer-related medications, including both active and inactive medications.
Procedure resource representing cancer-related surgical procedures.
Observation resource representing the cancer stage group.
Observation resource representing comorbidities.
Observation stating a linkage between one or more genotype/haplotype/variation Observations and evidence for or against a particular disease, condition, or cancer diagnosis.
Observations resource representing ECOG performance status assessment. Include past assessments if available.
Observation resource representing regions of the genome analyzed for variants.
DiagnosticReport resource representing genomics reports.
Specimen resource representing a specimen obtained for genomic analysis.
Observation resource representing genomic variants.
Observation resource representing Karnofsky performance status assessment. Include past assessments if available.
Procedure resource representing a course of treatment in cancer-related radiotherapy.
BodyStructure resource representing a volume in the body in cancer-related radiotherapy.
Condition resource representing any primary cancer condition.
Condition resource representing any secondary cancer condition.
BodyStructure resource representing a tumor having an identifier and being tracked over time.
Observation resources representing tumor marker or biomarker tests.
Observation resources representing a tumor size measurement.
Observation resources representing patient height, weight, blood pressure, and other vital signs.
